channel.title: BIOS Confessions
channel.description: Clear, structured explanations of core CS topics, from fundamentals to advanced principles. Learn for free, at your own pace.

item.title: The Cleaning Machine: 6 Steps to Trustworthy Data
item.description: Real-world data is chaotic. Master the 6-step framework for data wrangling using Python and Pandas to transform raw inputs into high-quality insights.

item.title: Stock Analysis with Python: Modeling Prices, Returns & Distributions
item.description: Learn how to analyze stock market data using Python. This guide covers calculating daily returns, visualizing volatility, and modeling statistical distributions with yfinance.

item.title: The Lab Setup: Preparing Your Local and Cloud Python Environment
item.description: A beginner-friendly guide to setting up a professional data science environment. Learn how to configure VS Code, manage virtual environments with venv, and leverage Google Colab for cloud computing.

item.title: The Geometry of Interest: Constructing Yield Curves and Forward Rates
item.description: Master the term structure of interest rates. Learn to build yield curves using bootstrapping and interpolation, and derive forward rates with practical Python examples.

item.title: Beyond the CPU: How I/O, Buses, and Multicore Systems Work
item.description: Explore computer architecture beyond the CPU. Learn about memory-mapped I/O, DMA, interrupts, the difference between CPUs and GPUs, and modern SoC design.

item.title: Life in the Tranches: Understanding CDOs and Risk Waterfalls
item.description: A deep dive into Collateralized Debt Obligations (CDOs). Learn how tranching redistributes credit risk into Senior, Mezzanine, and Equity layers with a Python waterfall simulation.

item.title: The CPU in Action: Mastering the Fetch-Decode-Execute Cycle
item.description: See the full picture of computer architecture. Learn how the ALU, Control Unit, and Registers coordinate to execute instructions in the Fetch-Decode-Execute cycle.

item.title: Loans and Bonds: The Mechanics of Borrowing and Default Risk
item.description: A quantitative guide to loan amortization and bond pricing. Learn to derive payment formulas, simulate default risk, and understand coupon rates using Python.

item.title: The Memory Hierarchy: From High-Speed Registers to Long-Term Storage
item.description: A complete guide to computer memory. Explore the trade-offs between speed and capacity in registers, CPU cache (L1/L2/L3), RAM, and virtual memory.

item.title: The Art of Losing Slowly: How to Manage Risk, Variance and Decisions Under Uncertainty
item.description: Master risk management through the lens of variance and expected value. Learn how to size bets, diversify risk, and implement decision-making logic in Python.

item.title: The Control Unit: How CPUs Decode and Execute Instructions
item.description: Learn how the CPU Control Unit acts as a conductor. Explore the differences between hardwired and microprogrammed control, and how instruction decoding works.

item.title: Finding P Values and False Hope: Intro to Quantitative Finance
item.description: Explore the intersection of math, stats, and Python in finance. Learn interest rates, compounding, risk management, and bond pricing with practical code examples.

item.title: Inside the ALU: How CPUs Calculate and Decide
item.description: Explore the Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU). Learn how CPUs perform binary math and logic using adders, multiplexers, and control signals.

item.title: Design Patterns for Performance: Scaling Beyond Simple Code
item.description: Master high-performance architecture. Explore the Reactor pattern, Actor model, and resilience strategies like Circuit Breakers and Load Shedding for low-latency systems.

item.title: Hello World in x86-64 Assembly: The Modern Step-by-Step Docker-Based Guide
item.description: Learn to write your first x86-64 assembly program from scratch. A zero-setup guide using Docker, NASM, and Linux syscalls for absolute beginners.

item.title: The Rescue Mission: Refactoring a 'Monster' Class Step-by-Step
item.description: Don't delete that messy code just yet. Learn how to transform a tightly coupled Java class into a clean, testable architecture using incremental refactoring and abstractions.

item.title: Logic Gates & Memory: Building an 8-Bit Adder from Scratch
item.description: How do transistors become logic? Learn about AND, OR, XOR gates, and how to build 8-bit adders and SR flip-flops for computer memory.

item.title: Transistors: The Tiny Switch That Powers Modern Computers
item.description: Learn how transistors work from the ground up. Explore semiconductors, N-type vs P-type doping, and the MOSFET drawbridge analogy in this beginner-friendly guide.

item.title: Introduction: Computer Architecture
item.description: Introduction for From Transistor to System: A Friendly Guide to Computer Architecture

item.title: The Art of Saying No: The Harsh Truth About Design Patterns
item.description: Stop pattern-worshipping and start solving problems. Learn why most developers misuse design patterns and how to pick the right architecture for real-world constraints.
